fields.text_html:
Welcome

This is an experiment in the economics of decision-making. The instructions are simple, and if you follow them carefully and make good decisions, you can earn a considerable amount of money that will be paid to you privately at the end of the experiment.

In this experiment, your name is #id_label#, and you are represented with the gear-shaped avatar in the center of your screen.

In this experiment, you and the other #player_count-1# people each control an avatar that can harvest goods from resource patches, consume those resources in your home, and interact with other avatars. Those resources will maintain your avatar's health which determines your earnings.

Your house is the one labeled #id_label#. A map in the top left corner of the screen shows where you are. Your house is marked in yellow. Try navigating the environment now by left-clicking on the screen to locate your house. Do this now.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Resource Patches

Resource patches are located throughout the environment. Each resource patch contains either cherries or blueberries . Each patch displays how many units are currently available to harvest. The amount available to harvest depends on the number of rings around the resource.

To harvest a patch, move your avatar close to one and right-click on it, then press Harvest   to transfer those units to your avatar. Do this now. After you harvest, the outer-most ring around the resource is greyed out, leaving fewer units for another person to harvest. Each time someone harvests a resource, one ring will disappear.

One ring, and only one ring, will grow back each period on each resource.

Each resource has a maximum number of rings, which may differ for different resources. If a resource already has its maximum number of rings, it will not grow any additional ones.

Your avatar can only harvest from one resource patch each period.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Sleep

A #night_length# second night phase will occur at the end of every period. During the night, you can optionally reset your avatar at your house. For every second of sleep your avatar gets, its health will rise by #heath_gain_per_sleep_second#. While your avatar is asleep, it cannot move or interact with the environment. To sleep,  right-click  on your house and press the Sleep   button. Avatars can only sleep during the night and will automatically awaken at the start of the next period.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Houses

Your house converts any resources it contains into health for your avatar at the end of each period. The amount of health you will gain is displayed at the bottom of your house. Move some of the resources you harvested earlier from your avatar into your house by moving your avatar close to your house and right-clicking on your house. Use the menu to select the desired amount, then press Move  . Do this now. Notice that the amount of health you will receive at the end of the period has increased.

Given a fixed total amount of resources, an equal number of cherries and blueberries in your house generates more health points than an unequal number of each type. For example, if you have six cherries  and six blueberries  in your house, #healthpoints_6_6# health points will be added to your total. But if you have two cherries and ten blueberries in your house, only #healthpoints_10_2# health points will be added. Additional single units of either resource will always increase the number of health points a house will generate.

You can move resources out of your house by changing the menu to "House -> Avatar".

You can move resources into another person's house, but you cannot move them out.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Health

Your earnings in this experiment are based on how healthy you keep your avatar. All avatars in this experiment have a health score displayed above them. This score ranges from zero to one hundred.

For each second that passes, you earn:

#earnings_per_second# x health score ¢

Avatars have a metabolism that slowly reduces their by #health_loss_per_second# health points for every second that passes.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Other Avatars

Every participant in this experiment is assigned an avatar. Your avatar can interact with other nearby avatars by right-clicking  on them. Move your avatar close to another avatar and interact with it. The other avatar must be within the circle surrounding your avatar to interact. Do this now. You can move resources to another avatar like you can move resources to a house.

You can attack another avatar by pressing the Attack  button at the bottom of the avatar interaction menu. An attack will reduce the target's health by #attack_damage# points. An attack will also reduce the attacker's health by #attack_cost# points. After an attack, the target and the attacker's avatar are subject to a #cool_down_length# second cool down where neither avatar can attack.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Groups

There are #number_of_groups# in this experiment. You are in the #group_name# group. Each group's houses are located in one of the #number_of_groups# different regions shown in the map in the top left corner of your screen. Until you visit another region, it will be blacked out on the map. As the experiment progresses, the bridges connecting the different regions will be opened, and you can travel to some of the other areas on the map. You will receive an on-screen notification when this event occurs.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Environmental Changes

During the experiment, environmental conditions may alter the growth and productive capabilities of the resource patches. You will receive an on-screen notification if this event occurs.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Chat

You can chat with other nearby avatars using the chat box at the bottom of your screen.

Avatars in other groups do not speak the same language as avatars in your group. This will limit the available words avatars in your group can use to communicate with other groups. Any words outside that limited set will appear in a different language to non-group members. It is up to you, your group, and other groups to discover which words work.

You are free to discuss any aspects of the experiment, with the following exceptions: you may not reveal your name, discuss side payments outside the laboratory, or engage in inappropriate language (including such shorthand as ‘WTF’). If you do, you will be excused and forgo your experiment earnings.

Every #break_frequency# periods has a #break_length# second break phase, where chatting is enabled, but all other interactions are disabled. Metabolism is paused during the break phase; your health will not decrease.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Summary

You control an avatar who's health determines your earnings in this experiment. You must consume resources in your house and/or sleep each period to maintain that health. Resources consumed in equal amounts will garner more health points than all of one resource or another.

Avatars can harvest resources from patches located throughout the environment. Those resources may change due to environmental changes as the experiments progress. Each avatar may only harvest one time per period.

Avatars can interact with each other. They can move resources between them or attack one another at a cost to both of their health. Avatars can chat with each other; however, avatars in different groups do not speak the same language as yours.

This is the end of the instructions. If you have any questions, please raise your hand, and a monitor will come by to answer them. If you are finished with the instructions, please click the Start   button located in the bottom right of this frame. The instructions will remain on your screen until the experiment begins. We need everyone to click the  Start   button before we can begin the experiment.
